010package imagingbook.common.color.quantize;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import java.util.Arrays;
015import java.util.LinkedList;
016import java.util.List;
017import java.util.Locale;
018import java.util.Random;
019
020import ij.IJ;
021import ij.ImagePlus;
022import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
023import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
024import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
025import imagingbook.common.color.RgbUtils;
026import imagingbook.common.color.statistics.ColorHistogram;
027
028/**
029 * <p>
030 * This class implements color quantization using k-means clustering of image
031 * pixels in RGB color space. It provides two modes for selecting initial color
032 * clusters: (a) random sampling of the input colors, (b) using the K most
033 * frequent colors.
034 * Note that this implementation is mainly to demonstrate the concept. Depending
035 * on the data size and number of quantization colors, this process may be
036 * excessively slow compared to other methods. It is usually impractical even
037 * for medium-sized images. During clustering all input pixels are used, i.e.,
038 * no stochastic sub-sampling is applied (which could make the process a lot
039 * more efficient).
040 * </p>
041 * 
042 * @author WB
043 * @version 2022/11/06
044 * @see MedianCutQuantizer
045 * @see OctreeQuantizer
046 */
047public class KMeansClusteringQuantizer implements ColorQuantizer {
048        
049        /**
050         * Seed for random number generation (set to a nonzero value to
051         * obtain repeatable results for debugging and testing).
052         */
053        public static long RandomSeed = 0;      
054        private final Random random = (RandomSeed == 0) ? new Random() : new Random(RandomSeed);
055        
056        public static int DefaultIterations = 500;
057        
058        private final ColorCluster[] clusters;
059        private final double totalError;
060        private final float[][] colormap;
061        
062        
063        /** Method for choosing initial color clusters. */
064        public enum InitialClusterMethod {
065                /** Use K different random colors to initialize clusters. */
066                Random,
067                /** Use the K most frequent image colors to initialize clusters. */
068                MostFrequent
069        };
070        
071        // --------------------------------------------------------------
072        
073        /**
074         * Constructor, creates a new {@link KMeansClusteringQuantizer} with up to K colors,
075         * using default parameters.
076         * 
077         * @param pixels an image as a aRGB-encoded int array
078         * @param K  the desired number of colors (1 or more)
079         */
080        public KMeansClusteringQuantizer(int[] pixels, int K) {
081                this(pixels, K, InitialClusterMethod.Random, DefaultIterations);
082        }
083
084        /**
085         * Constructor, creates a new {@link KMeansClusteringQuantizer} with up to K colors,
086         * but never more than the number of colors found in the supplied pixel data.
087         * 
088         * @param pixels an image as a aRGB-encoded int array
089         * @param K  the desired number of colors (1 or more)
090         * @param initMethod the method to initialize color clusters ({@link InitialClusterMethod})
091         * @param maxIterations the maximum number of clustering iterations 
092         */
093        public KMeansClusteringQuantizer(int[] pixels, int K, InitialClusterMethod initMethod, int maxIterations) {
094                clusters = initClusters(pixels, K, initMethod);
095                totalError = doCluster(pixels, maxIterations);
096                colormap = makeColorMap();
097        }
098        
099        // --------------------------------------------------------------
100
101        private ColorCluster[] initClusters(int[] pixels, int K, InitialClusterMethod method) {
102                int[] samples = null;
103                switch (method) {
104                case Random:
105                        samples = getRandomColors(pixels, K);
106                case MostFrequent:
107                        samples = getMostFrequentColors(pixels, K);
108                }
109                int k = Math.min(samples.length, K);
110                ColorCluster[] clstrs = new ColorCluster[k];    // create an array of k clusters
111                for (int i = 0; i < k; i++) {
112                        clstrs[i] = new ColorCluster(samples[i]);       // initialize cluster center
113                }
114                return clstrs; 
115        }
116
117        /**
118         * Returns (maximally) k colors randomly selected from the given pixel data.
119         */
120        private int[] getRandomColors(int[] pixels, int k) {
121                ColorHistogram colorHist = new ColorHistogram(pixels);
122                int[] colors = colorHist.getColors();
123                if (colors.length <= k) {
124                        return colors;
125                }
126                else {
127                        shuffle(colors, this.random);   // randomly permute colors
128                        return Arrays.copyOf(colors, k);
129                }
130        }
131        
132        /**
133         * Perform random permutation on the specified array.
134         * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1519736/random-shuffling-of-an-array
135         */
136        private void shuffle(int[] arr, Random random) {
137                for (int i = arr.length - 1; i > 0; i--) {
138                        int idx = random.nextInt(i + 1);
139                        int tmp = arr[idx];
140                        arr[idx] = arr[i];
141                        arr[i] = tmp;
142                }
143        }
144        
145        /**
146         * Returns the (maximally) k most frequent color values in the given pixel data.
147         * If fewer than k colors are available, these are returned, i.e., the resulting
148         * array may have less than k elements.
149         */
150        private int[] getMostFrequentColors(int[] pixels, int k) {
151                ColorHistogram colorHist = new ColorHistogram(pixels, true);    // sorts color bins by frequency
152                int[] colors = colorHist.getColors();
153                if (colors.length <= k) {
154                        return colors;
155                }
156                else {
157                        return Arrays.copyOf(colors, k);
158                }
159        }
160        
161        private double doCluster(int[] pixels, int maxIterations) {
162                int changed = Integer.MAX_VALUE;
163                double distSum = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
164                int j = 0;
165                while (changed > 0 && j < maxIterations) {
166                        distSum = assignSamples(pixels);
167                        changed = updateClusters();
168                        j++;
169                }
170                return distSum;
171        }
172
173        
174        private double assignSamples(int[] pixels) {
175                double distSum = 0;
176                for (int p : pixels) {
177                        double dist = addToClosestCluster(p);
178                        distSum = distSum + dist;
179                }
180                return distSum;
181        }
182        
183        private int updateClusters() {
184                int changed = 0;
185                for (ColorCluster c : clusters) {
186                        changed = changed + c.update();
187                }
188                return changed;
189        }
190        
191        private double addToClosestCluster(int p) {
192                double minDist = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
193                ColorCluster closest = null;
194                for (ColorCluster c : clusters) {
195                        double d = c.getSquaredDistance(p);
196                        if (d < minDist) {
197                                minDist = d;
198                                closest = c;
199                        }
200                }
201                closest.addPixel(p);
202                return minDist;
203        }
204
205        private float[][] makeColorMap() {
206                List<float[]> colList = new LinkedList<>();
207                for (ColorCluster c : clusters) {
208                        if (!c.isEmpty()) {
209                                colList.add(c.getCenterColor());
210                        }
211                }               
212                return colList.toArray(new float[0][]);
213        }
214        
215        // ------- methods required by abstract super class -----------------------
216        
217        @Override
218        public float[][] getColorMap() {
219                return colormap;
220        }
221        
222        
223        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
224        /**
225         * Lists the color clusters to System.out (for debugging only).
226         */
227        public void listClusters() {
228                for (ColorCluster c : clusters) {
229                        System.out.println(c.toString());
230                }
231        }
232        
233        /**
234         * Returns the final clustering error, calculated as the sum of
235         * the squared distances of the color samples to the associated cluster
236         * centers. This calculation is performed during the final iteration.
237         * 
238         * @return the final clustering error
239         */
240        public double getTotalError() {
241                return totalError;
242        }
243
244        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
245        
246        /**
247         * This inner class represents a color cluster. */
248        private static class ColorCluster {
249                private int sR, sG, sB;                         // RGB sums of contained pixels
250                private int pcount;                                     // pixel counter, used during pixel assignment
251                private int population = 0;                     // number of pixels contained in this cluster
252                private double cR, cG, cB;                      // center of this cluster
253
254                private ColorCluster(int p) {
255                        int[] rgb = RgbUtils.intToRgb(p);
256                        cR = rgb[0];
257                        cG = rgb[1];
258                        cB = rgb[2];
259                        reset();
260                }
261
262                private float[] getCenterColor() {
263                        return new float[] {(float)cR, (float)cG, (float)cB};
264                }
265
266                private boolean isEmpty() {
267                        return (population == 0);
268                }
269
270                private void reset() {  // reset sums, used at the start of the pixel assignment.
271                        sR = 0;
272                        sG = 0;
273                        sB = 0;
274                        pcount = 0;
275                }
276                
277                private void addPixel(int p) {
278                        int[] rgb = RgbUtils.intToRgb(p);
279                        sR += rgb[0];
280                        sG += rgb[1];
281                        sB += rgb[2];
282                        pcount = pcount + 1;
283                }
284                
285                /**
286                 * This method is invoked after all samples have been assigned to clusters. It
287                 * updates the cluster's center and returns by how much its population changed from
288                 * the previous clustering (absolute count).
289                 * @return the change in cluster population from the previous clustering
290                 */
291                private int update() {
292                        if (pcount > 0) {
293                                double scale = 1.0 / pcount;
294                                cR = sR * scale;
295                                cG = sG * scale;
296                                cB = sB * scale;
297                        }
298                        int changeCount = Math.abs(pcount - population);        // change in cluster population
299                        population = pcount;
300                        reset();
301                        return changeCount;     
302                }
303                
304                /**
305                 * Calculates and returns the squared Euclidean distance between the color p
306                 * and this cluster's center in RGB space.
307                 * @param p Color sample
308                 * @return squared distance to the cluster center
309                 */
310                private double getSquaredDistance(int p) {
311                        int[] rgb = RgbUtils.intToRgb(p);
312                        return sqr(rgb[0] - cR) + sqr(rgb[1] - cG) + sqr(rgb[2] - cB);
313                }
314                
315                @Override
316                public String toString() {
317                        return String.format(Locale.US, this.getClass().getSimpleName() +
318                                        ": ctr=(%.1f,%.1f,%.1f), pop=%d", cR, cG, cB, population);
319                }
320        }
321        
322        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
323        
324        public static void main(String[] args) {
325                String path = "D:/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/alps-01s.png";
326//              String path = "D:/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/desaturation-hsv/balls.jpg";
327//              String path = "C:/_SVN/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/desaturation-hsv/balls.jpg";
328                
329//              String path = "D:/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/single-color.png";
330//              String path = "D:/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/two-colors.png";
331//              String path = "D:/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/random-colors.png";
332//              String path = "D:/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/ramp-fire.png";
333                
334                int K = 16; 
335                System.out.println("image = " + path);
336                System.out.println("K = " + K);
337
338                ImagePlus im = IJ.openImage(path);
339                if (im == null) {
340                        System.out.println("could not open: " + path);
341                        return;
342                }
343                
344                ImageProcessor ip = im.getProcessor();
345                ColorProcessor cp = ip.convertToColorProcessor();
346                
347                ColorQuantizer quantizer = new KMeansClusteringQuantizer((int[])cp.getPixels(), K, InitialClusterMethod.Random, 500);
348                quantizer.listColorMap();
349                
350                System.out.println("quantizing image");
351                ByteProcessor qi = quantizer.quantize(cp);
352                System.out.println("showing image");
353                (new ImagePlus("quantizez", qi)).show();
354                
355        }
356        
357}
